definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: And so during the visual periods, the characters and paintings had common ancestry.
sentences.chinese: 文字学上的“表形文字”阶段，与绘画的始源同宗。

sentences.english: We want to strengthen the study of philology and hermeneutics in Mo-jing logic research.
sentences.chinese: 我们要加强墨经逻辑研究中的文字学和解释学研究。

sentences.english: YuPian is very important on literal-studying and critical interpretation of ancient texts in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 《玉篇》在我国文字学和训诂学史上至关重要。

sentences.english: All the three professors have been immerged in the study of paleography for years.
sentences.chinese: 三位教授都是多年研究古文字学的业界元老。

sentences.english: Variants in the sense of philology mainly refer to characters capable of replacing each other or variants of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 作为文字学意义上的异文，主要是指通假字和异体字。

sentences.english: Master Zhao not only understands philology, but also likes seal cutting and masters seal theories.
sentences.chinese: 赵氏不仅通文字学，还喜篆刻并精印学理论。

definition: study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject

Six Methods of forming Chinese characters, according to Han dictionary Shuowen 說文|说文 - namely, two primary methods: 象形 (pictogram), 指事 (ideogram), two compound methods: 會意|会意 (combined ideogram), 形聲|形声 (ideogram plus phonetic), and two transfer methods: 假借 (loan), 轉注|转注 (transfer)
sinology/Chinese studies (in foreign schools)/Han Learning, a Qing dynasty movement aiming at a philological appraisal of the Classics
